intro: Pisonia subovata, commonly known as the silky pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red bracts that surround its small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pisonia subovata is adapted to coastal and tropical environments, often found in sandy soils near the shore.
